problem_text:
Let G(K) be the Chevalley group over a commutative ring K associated with the root system Φ as defined in (R. Steinberg, Lectures on Chevalley groups, Yale Univ., New Haven, Conn., 1967). This group is generated by the root subgroups xr(K), r ∈ Φ. We define an elementary carpet of type Φ over K to be any collection of additive subgroups {Ar | r ∈ Φ} of K satisfying the condition
cij,rs Air Aj s ⊆ Air+js
for r, s, ir + js ∈ Φ, i > 0, j > 0,
where cij,rs are constants defined by the Chevalley commutator formula and Air = {ai | a ∈ Ar}. What are necessary and sufficient conditions (in terms of the Ar) on the elementary carpet to ensure that the subgroup ⟨xr(Ar) | r ∈ Φ⟩ of G(K) intersects with xr(K) in xr(Ar)? See also 15.46.
V. M. Levchuk
